Stripping away all of its known healing properties, I’d like to think the lesson to be learnt from Rainbow Fluorite is that beauty and love transcends physical appearance.

We’ve all been told to keep this crystal away from direct sunlight as its colors will fade overtime.

I recall my Dad’s personal rainbow fluorite piece which still sits in the family home. It was once colorful and striking—the reason why he purchased it some 20 years ago. 

I wasn’t sure if he had it out in the sunlight all these years, but what is left of it: a colorless transparent crystal, tinged with pale green. It is still beautiful, it is what I’ve known it to be. But now knowing it was once full of colors, makes it a little sad.

I love Rainbow Fluorite with all of its various hues from purple to green to blue and more, it makes me happy. It teaches me to cherish our time of youth. But I think I’m also ready to continue loving it, even when it loses all of its colors.

Sometimes, you find it hard to love yourself, or have done things that you're not proud of. We are not all made up of light, and just because you see your inner darkness, it doesn't mean you're a bad person or are in a bad place. Crystals are great, but they aren't a miracle cure for how you're feeling and what actions you will take. Only you are in control, so take charge and let's be real.
